issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem isn't valid and it can't be fixed.
resolution.name: Invalid

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
wordcount/hi/ dir is the input dir 

when i execute :

# bin/hadoop dfs -copyFromLocal wordcount/hi wordcount/ins

i get the foll msg

fields.summary: bad coonect ack with first bad link
fields.environment:
red hat Linux, cluster with 3 systems..
10.232.25.197- master
10.232.25.96-slave1
10.232.25.69-slave2

comments.body: Would it be possible for you to see if the same problem occurs when you are using version Hadoop 0.17.2. A few fixes in this area have occured in 0.17.x2release.

thank you..

i'll check whether it occurs in hadoop 17.2... 
at first i was able work fine with all 3.. i did not alter the required
files.. but suddenly i don no why this error is occuring..

I saw a lot of java.net.NoRouteToHostExceptions ere thrown at some datanodes. This kind of exception normally means that an error occurred while attempting to connect a socket to a remote address and port. Typically, the remote host cannot be reached because of an intervening firewall, or if an intermediate router is down.  Could you please check, for example, if you could connect to 10.232.25.69 at port 50010 from 10.232.25.96?

hey.. i found the firewall was on.. i it turned off manually...
now its running....
thank you..!
